content.body: Dominic Farolino: annevk: I think my recollection is a bit different. Workstreams have editors which have some theoretical powers (which rarely, if ever, get exercised). For some policy-adjacent reason we thought it'd be best to stick to one editor per workstream, although there are a few exceptions. Standards have authors. In practice authors are the core contributors to the spec. Also in some cases people who have contributed significantly historically but not currently are listed as authors.
